newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish shares soften under Ericsson pressure.
newsitem.headline: Swedish shares soften under Ericsson pressure.

text.p: Sweden's bourse closed lower on Tuesday after coming under pressure from telecoms heavyweight Ericsson and with the market hesitant.
Drugs major Astra had pulled the bourse higher by midday, rising on a bullish report in a U.S. finance magazine, but by the close it lost most its gains and the market dipped.
The Stockholm general index slipped 0.09 percent to 2165.27 after shares worth 3.6 billion crowns changed hands.
Brokers said a degree of uncertainty had infiltrated the market after hitting record highs in recent weeks and there was some concern the bourse could be heading for a correction.
Ericsson closed the day 3.5 crowns lower at 183 crowns.
Astra, after rising up to seven crowns during the day, closed just one crown higher at 306.5.
ABB AB, the Swedish arm of international electrical engineering group, fell eight crowns to 741 after posting its results for the first nine months of 1996.
Vehicle manufacturer Volvo was 0.5 crowns higher at 141 crowns ahead of the release of its nine month report Wednesday.
The bank sector index rose 0.37 percent. Sweden's central bank cut its key repo rate by 10 basis points to 4.85 percent.
